topic.title: XSLT Overview
topic.p: XSLT is the transformation part of the Extensible Style Language (XSL). It is an XML language for transforming XML documents (into something else).

Mozilla has excellent and nearly complete support for XSLT by way of the Transformix extension, which started outside of Mozilla but has gradually become more intregral to the browser, particularly as XSLT has emerged as a hot standard and developers have begun to use Mozilla as a transformation platform.

XSLT stylesheets can transform XML arbitrarily with a system of recursive matching rules (using XPath) and templates applied to those matches. In this demo, we use a small set of rules and a method in the XSLT language, document(), to aggregate a list of XML "topics" into a single HTML document for display.
The XSLT function that drives this demo is document(), described in the section below.
